subject: RE : [junit] Re: MyClass.class.getResource() problem with JUnit (Eclipse plugin)
msgSnippet: Hello ! Thanks a lot for your answer ! ... Yes, my bin directory (which contains all my .class files) contains the resource directory with its myConfig.conf
messageBody:
Hello !

Thanks a lot for your answer !

> Are you sure the file myConfig.conf is compile to
> classes or this
> file is at classpath? Maybe your path
> 'resources/myConfig.conf' is
> incorrect?
>

Yes, my "bin" directory (which contains all my .class
files) contains the resource directory with its
myConfig.conf file.
And when i launch my test, Eclipse provides the "bin"
directory into the classpath.

For information, here is how Eclipse is running my
test Class (I removed the classpath for an easier
reading).

org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner
-version 3 -port 56994 -testLoaderClass
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit4.runner.JUnit4TestLoader
-classNames MiddlewareTest

But when I run the Middleware as a standalone
application (not using JUnit), there is no problem...
Any other tip is welcome !

Thanks in advance.

Joël
